organic_results.title: Expert rating on academic leadership as a measure of institutional quality
organic_results.snippet: Research on higher education has increased appreciably the past decade. In addition, the sophistication of inquiry has risen correspondingly. Both events are good news. But increased output also means that methodological practices should be monitored. Utilizing outside experts as an independent measure of academic leadership and/or institutional quality is a potentially effective technique. This note reports findings which introduce cautions with regard to such a practice. Institutional quality is an image. As Cartter (1966: 4) …

publication_info.summary: RT Blackburn, WJ Gerber - Sociology of Education, 1974 - JSTOR
